profile_positions.description: Responsible for developing seasonal range plans, incorporating consumer insights, market trends and commercial opportunities; driving seasonal planning process with country teams, advising on growth opportunities for the brand; validating planning and buying decisions to budget and strategy agreements, delivering informed insights, evolving analytical capabilities and promoting actions based on consumer trends; partnering with country teams on in-season sales and stock management.
profile_positions.title: Merchandise Planner

profile_positions.description: Responsible for reaching EBIT/Net Sales targets through active development and maximization of direct and forward order sales within all chosen channels and segments; Collecting feedback from markets regarding needs for (upcoming) collection (e.g. styles, colors, and trends), providing input and feedback at key meetings; Preparing product group sales forecast by collecting sell-out data, performing seasonal analysis, and taking images of previous and upcoming collections, key looks, and consumer assortment into account; Building and customizing assortments per door, based on insights obtained during previous seasons (e.g. sell-out data and client touchpoints); Presenting, explaining and selling collection to customers during sell-in, while aiming to have 80% of total (i.e. key accounts) orders in to ensure on time delivery for first drop; Maintaining close relationships with internal stakeholders throughout development and sell-in process to ensure alignment across product groups, and acting on new opportunities or issues; Maintaining close relationships with customers and provide in-season support; Ensuring accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of data in Digital Showroom (e.g. orders), by continuously updating the system throughout sell-in period.
profile_positions.title: Sales Executive MEA+

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for executing quality growth through understanding of Sales & Merchandising
principles within the MEA+ Sales & Merchandising Team for all TH and CK Divisions. Main
Responsibilities: Manage the seasonal sell-in process for TH and CK Divisions for the MEA+
Region; Following Divisional Sales / Merchandising strategy for MEA+ region ensuring commercial
targets are met whilst maximizing brand impact; Working with Managers to evolve Divisional
performance against KPI's as you progress through the seasonal process; Maintaining & Nurturing
strong relationships with our partners through sell in process; Collaborating with Divisions and other
members of the Sales & Merchandising Team to ensure knowledge and best practices are shared
and information flows freely Merchandising; Working with multiple stakeholders providing support
during sales appointments with MEA+ partners and entering orders to the system to ensure that the
selling season goals would be reached, delivering consumer relevant outfits. Ultimately, delivering
an assortment that contributes to an elevated in-store brand experience for the consumer whilst
maximizing revenues and profit.
profile_positions.title: Sales Support Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Providing day-to-day support as required to the Commercial Managers of MEA+ region (Middle East, Greece area and Africa) and internal sales support in terms of franchised partners enquiries for Tommy Hilfiger and Calvin Klein brands, understanding client’s business needs and proposing appropriate solutions, processing orders and invoices, also providing support for customer service team. Liaising with various internal departments and following up on franchised partners queries; primary duties centered on preparing clear sales/commercial analysis through weekly reports, developing market research, competitor and sales analysis / forecasting functions, preparing power point presentations about market and economic overview and also retail landscape about the country or area requested according to the expansion plan to develop sales goals and marketing strategies.

Responsible for handling deals with ocean and air product departments, as well with the local offices of CEVA abroad; updating freight agreements of corporate customers, BID's negotiations and prospecting new customers.
